channel.title: The iPhone
channel.description: On July 11th the iPhone will be making it's first [i]official[/i] appearance in Canada. Seeing as my current phone plan ends on July 17th, and I need to get a new phone either way, I decided I should get the iPhone, because I also needed a new ipod. The main question is, is it worth $199-$299, and should I get it?

item.title: The iPhone
item.dc:creator: @Renax Renax
item.description:
@Renax wrote:

Wait until fall and get an HTC dream running android.

Read full topic

item.title: The iPhone
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:24, topic:215392”][quote author=billygotshot link=topic=283109.msg2300193#msg2300193 date=1214561861]

[quote author=Tico135 link=topic=283109.msg2297825#msg2297825 date=1214467123] is it worth $199-$299, and should I get it?
[/quote]

and 599$
[/quote]

WTF are you talking about?

They will discontinue the iPhone 1.0 after they release the 3G.
++ it’s not $599, its $399. $499 for the 16GB.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 26, 2008, 11:21:03 PM[/size][hr][quote author=billygotshot link=topic=283109.msg2300193#msg2300193 date=1214561861]
Forget it. btw in the first post you can see how she says “199-299”.
[/quote]

Ya. It’s $199/$299 for the 3G version.[/quote]

Also the first quote is from an article I found on google dealing with the first iphone.

it's that the 1.0 release at $500 and $600

That explains where I was getting 599$ from. My point is that a better phone is worth less money. Also that the price has dropped by 300-400 bucks.

Read full topic

item.title: The iPhone
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Checked the price. (In Norway)

20 cent for the iPhone but 219$ ea month in one year.
1000 free sms, 1000 free minutes of phone-call and 1000 free MB traffic ea month.
For the most expensive subscription.

Or 278$ for the iPhone and 79$ ea month for one year.
100 free sms, 100 free minutes of phone-call and 100 free MB traffic ea month.

Its not so expensive that I expected.

Read full topic

item.title: The iPhone
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

FastBawlz:

[quote]I don’t see how another phone with a micro sized ‘keyboard’ can compare to an iPhone.

Eh, probably because your a ignorant fanboy.

I doubt that any other phone has a REAL internet browser on it, or a whole OS for that matter.

HTC Diamond. Also, the iPhone “OS” is as much of a OS as Windows Mobile.

The Apps store is coming out on it and they even have an SDK for developing on it.

Windows Mobile phones can do that right out of the box.

The iPhone is not just a phone, its a whole computer.

Lol.

The games that developers were able to write for it are amazing.

Yes. Super Monkey Ball is definitely amazing.

You can’t compare the iPhone to ‘smart phones’.

Yes you can.

Its like comparing a super computer to a laptop.

Yes. If the laptop is the iPhone.

Also, at the idiots saying “LOL ITS SO MUCH CHEAPER!!!@!111”
No.

The phones for Sprint aren’t charted correctly since they can get the same plan as the iPhone for $30 less, which makes it about $1000 cheaper.[/quote]

When they first came out it said 600$ instead of 199$.

Read full topic

item.title: The iPhone
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

I don't see how another phone with a micro sized 'keyboard' can compare to an iPhone.
Eh, probably because your a ignorant fanboy.
I doubt that any other phone has a REAL internet browser on it, or a whole OS for that matter.
HTC Diamond. Also, the iPhone "OS" is as much of a OS as Windows Mobile.
The Apps store is coming out on it and they even have an SDK for developing on it.
Windows Mobile phones can do that right out of the box.
The iPhone is not just a phone, its a whole computer.
Lol.
The games that developers were able to write for it are amazing.
Yes. Super Monkey Ball is definitely amazing.
You can't compare the iPhone to 'smart phones'.
Yes you can.
Its like comparing a super computer to a laptop.
Yes. If the laptop is the iPhone.

Also, at the idiots saying “LOL ITS SO MUCH CHEAPER!!!@!111”
No. Your just one of those idiots fooled by Apple’s bullshit.

The phones for Sprint aren’t charted correctly since they can get the same plan as the iPhone for $30 less, which makes it about $1000 cheaper.

Here’s a chart made by Apple that’s bullshiting you some more.

The audio playback/internet use/talk time, complete bullshit.
My mom, brother, both have an iPhone, it certainly isn’t that long.

Read full topic

item.title: The iPhone
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

[quote=“billygotshot, post:18, topic:215392”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=283109.msg2299812#msg2299812 date=1214552493]

i hate iphones, mainly 'cause i hate apple. Maddox’s post on it is awesome http://www.thebestpageintheuniverse.net/c.cgi?u=iphone
[/quote]Best comparison EVER. Really puts out the truth about the iPhone.

Not really. You can mod the iphone to do everything he said his phone can. The only downside is that the screen does smudge and it is hard to type.[/quote]
How big can your fingers get. My brother has an iPod Touch and typing is a breeze. Also jail breaking those things let you do lots of interesting things.
I don’t see how another phone with a micro sized ‘keyboard’ can compare to an iPhone. I doubt that any other phone has a REAL internet browser on it, or a whole OS for that matter. The Apps store is coming out on it and they even have an SDK for developing on it.

The iPhone is not just a phone, its a whole computer. Watch Apple’s keynotes if you have ~2 hours to kill. The games that developers were able to write for it are amazing. You can’t compare the iPhone to ‘smart phones’. They aren’t in the same category. Its like comparing a super computer to a laptop.

Read full topic
